bobby.engine.bobengine

Class BobActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • bobby.engine.bobengine.BobActivity

  • public abstract class BobActivity
extends Activity
    This class is an extension of the Android Activity class which adds additional functionality which is useful for games.

    Additional functionality includes easy methods for retrieving the dimensions of the screen and using immersive mode.
    Author:
    Ben

    • Method Detail

      • getScreenWidth

        public int getScreenWidth()
        Returns the width of the screen. You may also directly access the variable "screenWidth" to get the width of the screen but if the orientation of the device has been changed this function may be called to update screenWidth.

        On devices using API level 13 and higher, this function will return the real width of the screen including things like the navigation bar and title bar.

        BobView includes a function to get just the width of the view.
        Returns:
        - Width of the screen, in pixels.

      • getScreenHeight

        public int getScreenHeight()
        Returns the width of the screen. You may also directly access the variable "screenWidth" to get the width of the screen but if the orientation of the device has been changed this function may be called to update screenWidth.

        On devices using API level 13 and higher, this function will return the real height of the screen including things like the navigation bar and title bar.

        BobView includes a function to get just the height of the view.
        Returns:
        - Width of the screen, in pixels.

      • useImmersiveMode

        public void useImmersiveMode()
        Uses KitKat's immersive mode. Immersive mode only works on Android 4.4.2 and up. There is no need to check for version number when using this method. This method will handle older versions for you.

      • onResume

        public void onResume()

      • saveInt

        public void saveInt(java.lang.String name,
                    int value)
        Save an integer value. It can be retrieved even after the application has quit by calling getSavedInt();
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the saved integer. Will be used for retrieval.
        value - - value to save.

      • saveBool

        public void saveBool(java.lang.String name,
                     boolean value)
        Save an boolean value. It can be retrieved even after the application has quit by calling getSavedBool();
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the saved boolean. Will be used for retrieval.
        value - - value to save.

        value - - value to save.

        Save an string value. It can be retrieved even after the application has quit by calling getSavedString();
        Parameters:

        value - - value to save.
